intro: Psychotria macrophylla subsp. anomothyrsa, commonly known as the purple psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are clustered in cymes and are often visited by various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The plant contains alkaloids and has been of interest in ethnobotanical studies due to its potential medicinal properties.
